Module: High Availability and Scalability: ELB & ASG

Summaries.value1: The Application Load Balancer is best suited for load balancing HTTP and HTTPS traffic and provides advanced request routing targeted at the delivery of modern application architectures

Summaries.value2: AWS Auto Scaling monitors your applications and automatically adjusts capacity to maintain steady, predictable performance at the lowest possible cost.

Summaries.value3: Scaling is the ability to increase or decrease the compute capacity of your application

Summaries.value4: Distribute traffic across backend EC2 instances, can be Multi-AZ

Summaries.value5: A load balancer distributes incoming application traffic across multiple EC2 instances in multiple Availability Zones.

Summaries.value6: Network Load Balancer is best suited for load balancing of TCP, UDP, TLS traffic where extreme performance is required.

Summaries.value1:
Network drives attached to one EC2 instance at a time
Mapped to an Availability Zones
Can use EBS Snapshots for backups / transferring EBS volumes across AZ

Summaries.value2: Use Amazon EBS encryption as a straight-forward encryption solution for your EBS resources

Summaries.value3: You specify the EBS volumes and instance store volumes for your instance using a block device mapping

Summaries.value4: With Amazon EBS, you can use any of the standard RAID configurations that you can use with a traditional bare metal server

Summaries.value5: Create a point-in-time snapshot of an EBS volume

Summaries.value6:
• gp2: General Purpose Volumes (cheap)
  • io1: Provisioned IOPS (expensive)
  • st1: Throughput Optimized HDD
  • sc1: Cold HDD, Infrequently accessed data

Summaries.value7: Amazon EFS provides scalable file storage for use with Amazon EC2

Summaries.value1: Highly available and scalable cloud Domain Name System (DNS) web service
Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) is an object storage service

Summaries.value2: Amazon S3 allows people to store objects (files) in 'buckets'

Summaries.value3: Objects (files) have a Key, The key is the FULL path:

Summaries.value4: Versioning in Amazon S3 is a means of keeping multiple variants of an object in the same bucket

Summaries.value5: You can set the default encryption behavior for an S3 bucket so that all new objects are encrypted when they are stored in the bucket

Summaries.value6: To protect your data in Amazon S3, by default, users only have access to the S3 resources they create

Summaries.value7: You can use Amazon S3 to host a static website

Summaries.value8: Cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) defines a way for client web applications that are loaded in one domain to interact with resources in a different domain

Summaries.value9: Amazon S3 delivers strong read-after-write consistency automatically for all applications

Module: AWS CLI SDK IAM Roles & Policies
Summary: AWS CLI SDK IAM Roles & Policies

Summaries.value1: The AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) is a unified tool to manage your AWS services.

Summaries.value2: Instance metadata is data about your instance that you can use to configure or manage the running instance. Instance metadata is divided into categories, for example, host name, events, and security groups.

Summaries.value3: Easily develop applications on AWS in the programming language of your choice

Summaries.value1: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) is an object storage service

Summaries.value2: Server access logging provides detailed records for the requests that are made to a bucket

Summaries.value3: Replication enables automatic, asynchronous copying of objects across Amazon S3 buckets

Summaries.value4: Versioning in Amazon S3 is a means of keeping multiple variants of an object in the same bucket

Summaries.value5: All objects by default are private. Only the object owner has permission to access these objects.

Summaries.value6:
Amazon S3 Standard - General Purpose
Amazon S3 Standard-Infrequent Access (IA)
Amazon S3 One Zone-Infrequent Access
Amazon S3 Intelligent Tiering
Amazon Glacier
Amazon Glacier Deep Archive
Amazon S3 Reduced Redundancy Storage (deprecated - omitted)

Summaries.value7: To manage your objects so that they are stored cost effectively throughout their lifecycle, configure their Amazon S3 Lifecycle

Summaries.value8: Amazon S3 automatically scales to high request rates

Summaries.value9: Enables applications to retrieve only a subset of data from an object by using simple SQL expressions

Summaries.value10: You can use the Amazon S3 Event Notifications feature to receive notifications when certain events happen in your S3 bucket

Summaries.value11: Amazon Athena is an interactive query service that makes it easy to analyze data in Amazon S3 using standard SQL

Summaries.key12: S3 Object Lock & Glacier Vault Lock
Summaries.value12: You can store objects using a write-once-read-many (WORM) model

Summaries.value1: Fast content delivery network (CDN) service that securely delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to customers globally with low latency, high transfer speeds

Summaries.value2: Includes additional information, for example, an expiration date and time, that gives you more control over access to your content

Summaries.value3: Networking service that sends your user’s traffic through Amazon Web Service’s global network infrastructure

Summaries.value1: AWS Snowball, a part of the AWS Snow Family, is an edge computing, data migration, and edge storage device.

Summaries.value2: Hybrid cloud storage service that gives you on-premises access to virtually unlimited cloud storage

Summaries.value3: Makes it easy and cost effective to launch and run popular file systems that are fully managed by AWS

Summaries.value1: Amazon SQS offers standard as the default queue type

Summaries.value2: When a consumer receives and processes a message from a queue, the message remains in the queue

Summaries.value3: Makes it easy and cost effective to launch and run popular file systems that are fully managed by AWS

Summaries.value4: Delay queues let you postpone the delivery of new messages to a queue for a number of seconds

Summaries.value5: FIFO (First-In-First-Out) queues are designed to enhance messaging between applications when the order of operations and events is critical

Summaries.value6: fully managed messaging service for both application-to-application (A2A) and application-to-person (A2P) communication.
